pull.title: rpc: Adding a 'logpath' entry to getrpcinfo

events.body:
edit: Also, looks like you are referencing this PR in the title.

This is failing on both Windows builds:

[Win32](https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/498675434)
```
  GEN      qt/moc_bantablemodel.cpp
rpc/server.cpp: In function ‘UniValue getrpcinfo(const JSONRPCRequest&)’:
rpc/server.cpp:317:72: error: no matching function for call to ‘UniValue::UniValue(UniValue::VType, const value_type*)’
     UniValue log_path(UniValue::VSTR, LogInstance().m_file_path.c_str());
                                                                        ^
In file included from ./rpc/protocol.h:16:0,
                 from ./rpc/server.h:10,
                 from rpc/server.cpp:6:
./univalue/include/univalue.h:46:5: note: candidate: UniValue::UniValue(const char*)
```

[Win64](https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/498675435)
```
  GEN      qt/moc_bantablemodel.cpp
  GEN      qt/moc_bitcoinaddressvalidator.cpp
rpc/server.cpp: In function ‘UniValue getrpcinfo(const JSONRPCRequest&)’:
rpc/server.cpp:317:72: error: no matching function for call to ‘UniValue::UniValue(UniValue::VType, const value_type*)’
     UniValue log_path(UniValue::VSTR, LogInstance().m_file_path.c_str());
                                                                        ^
In file included from ./rpc/protocol.h:16:0,
                 from ./rpc/server.h:10,
                 from rpc/server.cpp:6:
./univalue/include/univalue.h:46:5: note: candidate: UniValue::UniValue(const char*)
```
I changed `c_str()` to `native()` in order to return a `string_type`.

rename.from: Adding a 'logpath' entry to getrpcinfo, as discussed in #15438
rename.to: rpc: Adding a 'logpath' entry to getrpcinfo

events.body:
Concept ACK. Can you add a test, e.g. in `test/functional/interface_rpc.py`? You can get the expected log path with `os.path.join(self.nodes[0].datadir, 'debug.log')`

Using `native()` didn't work. Maybe @ken2812221 knows why the win32 and win64 builds fail?

It's better to remove `fixes #15438` from the commit message. It's already in the pull request description, which automatically gets added to the merge commit.

@Sjors `os.path.join(self.nodes[0].datadir, 'debug.log')` does not link to the good file. It outputs `/tmp/bitcoin_func_test_tj4444vh/node0/debug.log` instead of `/tmp/bitcoin_func_test_tj4444vh/node0/regtest/debug.log`.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.
IMO this is not RPC info and as such should not be added here.

tACK 59c91b9, but let's wait for discussion in #15438 to settle.

The lack of escape characters (e.g. space) is annoying, but I'm not sure if it's appropriate to add them. 

```sh
bitcoin-cli getrpcinfo | jq -r '.logpath'
/Users/bitcoin/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/testnet3/debug.log

tail -f "`bitcoin-cli getrpcinfo | jq -r '.logpath'`"
```

> The lack of escape characters (e.g. space) is annoying, but I'm not sure if it's appropriate to add them.

What kind of escaping would you want to add here? UniValue already adds JSON escaping, so I would think any extra layers of escaping would just break your tail command and be more annoying.
@ryanofsky only escaping spaces in the path
NACK, I think #15493 is a better solution for OP.

> What kind of escaping would you want to add here? UniValue already adds JSON escaping, so I would think any extra layers of escaping would just break your tail command and be more annoying.

Definite *don't* add any extra escaping. If we add this field, it needs to be usable from other JSON clients as well which don't do any other unquoting besides parsing JSON. 
String sanitization is only relevant for potentially hostile input, from, say, the P2P network.

verification.payload:
tree db61adc3ef90d7e338c10860356bebfdebfdde13
parent 8f2f17f79a10ab3db13f95291d302f5eae3e3a91
author darosior <darosior@protonmail.com> 1558040460 +0200
committer darosior <darosior@protonmail.com> 1558040460 +0200

Add a 'logpath' field to getrpcinfo

events.body: Rebased, but is it still needed or #15493 will be prefered ?

I think getting the log path through RPC can be useful (say, if you have some kind of monitoring program such as [bitcoind-ncurses](https://github.com/esotericnonsense/bitcoind-ncurses2) that connects to the RPC and needs to show the logs) and  #15493 doesn't entirely replace that use case.

Tested ACK 8a6810d0d2759c69f63b53c48aa79e0cfdd88ffb

issue.title: rpc: Add logpath description for getrpcinfo
[feature] bitcoin-cli log
issue.body:
The location of log files depends on the operating system and on which network you're using.

It would be nice to have a shortcut which wraps `tail [-f] <datadir>/<network>/debug.log`. It would do what `bitcoind -printtoconsole` does now, but for `bitcoin-cli` so you don't have to restart.

A simpler alternative is a command that returns the log path, e.g.:

```
tail -f `bitcoin-cli logpath`
```

comments.body: Could use `m_file_path.string()` instead. It might fix the issue.

+        assert(info['logpath'] == os.path.join(self.nodes[0].datadir, 'regtest', 'debug.log'))
